dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Okay, so, Elon Musk. Always in the headlines, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Okay, so, Elon Musk. Always in the headlines, right?

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Oh, absolutely. And this latest tidbit, um, about his finances? It's pretty wild.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, absolutely. And this latest tidbit, um, about his finances? It's pretty wild.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, he revealed he's got, like, a $20 billion fortune. But the kicker is he *insists* he has substantial liquid assets.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, he revealed he's got, like, a twenty billion dollar fortune. But the kicker is he insists he has substantial liquid assets.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Tesla and SpaceX CEO confirmed he has roughly a $20 billion fortune (Forbes pegs it at $23.6 billion), but added that his liquid assets are relatively low. Some people think I have a lot of cash, he said. I actually dont.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Right, because everyone always thinks he's just, you know, all shares and no actual cash. But he's like, "Nope, I actually do."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right, because everyone always thinks he's just, you know, all shares and no actual cash. But he's like, Nope, I actually do.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Some people think I have a lot of cash, he said. I actually dont.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Which, I mean, is a pretty big deal considering that trial he's facing.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, I mean, is a pretty big deal considering that trial he's facing.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The revelation adds to the stakes of the trial. If the jury levels a large judgment against Musk, he may have to sell part of his stake in Tesla or SpaceX, a move he has historically avoided.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Totally. Because if he loses, the speculation is he'll just, uh, increase his stake in Tesla or SpaceX. Which he's done before, like, historically.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Totally. Because if he loses, the speculation is he'll just, uh, increase his stake in Tesla or SpaceX. Which he's done before, like, historically.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: If the jury levels a large judgment against Musk, he may have to sell part of his stake in Tesla or SpaceX, a move he has historically avoided.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, or, like, borrow more money using his shares as collateral. Which, by the way, he already does quite a bit.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, or, like, borrow more money using his shares as collateral. Which, by the way, he already does quite a bit.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: (Another possibility: He could borrow more money, using his shares as collateral.)...Musk, 48, owes more than $500 million in debts, according to financial documents published earlier this year. That includes $208.9 million in liabilities owed to Morgan Stanley and $213 million borrowed from an affiliate of Goldman Sachs. Musk has pledged nearly half of his Tesla stake as collateral for those loans.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, Forbes estimates, like, 99% of his wealth is actually tied up in those two companies. So, the liquidity thing, it makes sense why he'd bring it up.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, Forbes estimates, like, ninety nine percent of his wealth is actually tied up in those two companies. So, the liquidity thing, it makes sense why he'd bring it up.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: As much as 99% of Musks wealth is held in shares of those two companies, Forbes estimates, which helps explain his lack of liquidity.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But then, you look at his financial documents, and he's almost debt-free, despite, like, having these huge assets with Morgan Stanley and Goldman. It's kinda wild, right?
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then, you look at his financial documents, and he's almost debt-free, despite, like, having these huge assets with Morgan Stanley and Goldman. It's kinda wild, right?
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: More important, Musk, 48, owes more than $500 million in debts, according to financial documents published earlier this year. That includes $208.9 million in liabilities owed to Morgan Stanley and $213 million borrowed from an affiliate of Goldman Sachs.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: It really is. And I always forget just how, uh, relatively recent his entrepreneurial journey is. Like, Zip2 in '99, then PayPal.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: It really is. And I always forget just how, uh, relatively recent his entrepreneurial journey is. Like, Zip2 in ninety nine, then PayPal.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He made his first fortune after selling Zip2, a software firm, to Compaq in 1999 for a reported price of more than $300 million. Three years later Paypal, which he also cofounded, was acquired by eBay for $1.4 billion.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: Right? Then he starts SpaceX in 2002 and joins Tesla in 2004. And, like, he used most of his PayPal earnings for those, apparently.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Right? Then he starts S P A C E X in two thousand two and joins Tesla in two thousand four. And, like, he used most of his PayPal earnings for those, apparently.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The South Africa native founded SpaceX in 2002 and joined Tesla in 2004; the firms quickly exhausted most of his PayPal earnings, according to a 2015 Musk biography.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah, and he even said, like, about SpaceX, it's "not the path to go to maximize riches." It's a "terrible risk-adjusted return."
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah, and he even said, like, about S P A C E X, it's not the path to go to maximize riches. It's a terrible risk-adjusted return.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: This is not the path to go to maximize riches, he told Forbes in 2012, referring to SpaceX. Its a terrible risk-adjusted return.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: [chuckles] Which, you know, makes sense given his whole "affect the future of humanity" spiel.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Which, you know, makes sense given his whole affect the future of humanity spiel.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead he founded the space exploration company, he said, because it was his way to most affect the future of humanity and civilization.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Exactly! It's always about the bigger vision for him, like with Tesla too.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Exactly! It's always about the bigger vision for him, like with Tesla too.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: He has made similar comments about his motivations at Tesla.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: But then, you also have, like, the time he tweeted about taking Tesla private, which, uh, got him an SEC fine.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: But then, you also have, like, the time he tweeted about taking Tesla private, which, uh, got him an S E C fine.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: In addition to the defamation suit, he stirred controversy in 2018 after tweeting that he was considering taking Tesla private, an announcement that caught investors by surprise. Following an SEC investigation, he paid a $20 million fine and stepped down as the carmakers chairman.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: [interrupts] Oh, God, yeah. And, um, more recently, the Cybertruck window incident!
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Oh, God, yeah. And, um, more recently, the Cybertruck window incident!

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: You know, with the metal ball, and he's like, "Oh my f***ing God!"
dialogue_turns.tts_text: You know, with the metal ball, and he's like, Oh my f*ing God!
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Last month, during the introduction of Teslas new Cybertruck, he attempted to prove the durability of the trucks armor glass windows with a metal ball. Instead the window shattered. Oh my fing God, said a surprised Musk.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: Yeah! And it totally shattered. Which is, you know, not ideal when you're trying to prove durability.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: Yeah! And it totally shattered. Which is, you know, not ideal when you're trying to prove durability.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Instead the window shattered. His chief designer tested another window. Then it shattered, too.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_A
dialogue_turns.text: And he's admitting they have "improvements to make" before production. But, like, only 250,000 preorders so far.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: And he's admitting they have improvements to make before production. But, like, only two hundred fifty thousand preorders so far.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: Still, Musk reports that more than 250,000 customers have preordered the vehicle. But, he tweeted, Guess we have some improvements to make before production haha.

dialogue_turns.speaker: Host_B
dialogue_turns.text: For something so hyped, that's, uh, interesting. So, he's rich, liquid, but also, you know, still figuring things out on the product side.
dialogue_turns.tts_text: For something so hyped, that's, uh, interesting. So, he's rich, liquid, but also, you know, still figuring things out on the product side.
dialogue_turns.evidence_snippet: The Tesla and SpaceX CEO confirmed he has roughly a $20 billion fortune (Forbes pegs it at $23.6 billion), but added that his liquid assets are relatively low. Some people think I have a lot of cash, he said. I actually dont.
